bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. of swelling, pain and festering brought forth by water/moisture affecting open sores. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 25: 治因瘡腫痛者，皆中水及中風寒所作腫 , “To cure swelling and pain resulting from sores, these are always swellings resulting from [the sores] having been struck by water or wind cold”.

② Pathological Condition identical with shui du 水毒 , water poisoning. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry xi gui chong 溪 鬼蟲 quoting Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 7: 水毒中人，一名中溪，一名中灑，一名水病 , “When water poison enters a person, this is also called ‘struck by a rivulet’; ‘struck by sprinkling water’, and ‘water disease’”, writes: 溪毒中人，一名中水，一名中 溪，一名水病 , “when rivulet poison strikes a person, this is also called ‘ struck by water ’; ‘struck by a rivulet’; and ‘water disease’”. ③ Reference to all types of items that have been affected by water. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 3: 以 不中水豬膏一斤，微火上煎 , “Take lard that has not been struck by water and boil it on a mild fire”.
